DataElement.preferredName: RT Beam Isocenter Float 16 Character Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Isocenter coordinates (x,y,z) in the patient based coordinate system described in C.7.6.2.1.1 (mm).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles._Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0 ,0).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A group of nearly parallel rays of electromagnetic radiation or a stream of particles.

Property.preferredDefinition: Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0 ,0).

Concepts.definition: Either a point at which there is a maximum or minimum of a radiation dose or the center point of a radiation field where the origin of the coordinate system is (x, y, z) = (0, 0, 0).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/26/20 jk released per SO quarterly review for DICOM.  11/20/13 created for a Norton CC DICOM RT study. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: DS: A string of characters representing either a fixed point number or a floating point number. A fixed point number shall contain only the characters 0-9 with an optional leading "+" or "-" and an optional "." to mark the decimal point. A floating point number shall be conveyed as defined in ANSI X3.9, with an "E" or "e" to indicate the start of the exponent. Decimal Strings may be padded with leading or trailing spaces. Embedded spaces are not allowed.  (valid characters 0-9, +,-, E,e,".") [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/27/08 - released post NCIA Interim Rpt Changes;  12/31/07 - chg long & short name to reflect "floating" aspect of value domain as indicated in the definition; semantics and max/min length did not change.  6/8/07-typo in def corrected.  6/4/07-Removed 15 decimal requirement.  5/10/07- Changed long to match Rep term qualifiers.  1/6/07-released VD so it can be reused in other imaging CDE.  1/4/07-2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6
